tours.name: Silk Route Motorcycle Tour
highlights: Kyrgyzstan is one of the best-kept secrets of Central Asia. It is a magical land of snowcapped mountains that disappear into the clouds, alpine lakes with turquoise water, stunning gorges, glacial rivers and vast swathes of velvety grasslands dotted with wild horses and cattle grazing peacefully.Located to the north of India, Kyrgyzstan is a landlocked country but has the world’s second largest alpine lake, the Issyk-Kul.Motorover’s weeklong, guided motorcycle tour of the Silk Route in Kyrgyzstan starts and ends in the country’s bustling capital, Bishkek. There will be a MotoRover tour manager on the lead bike and the group will be followed by the sweep car that carries your luggage and has a mechanic and first-aid kit on board to ensure that you get the support required to explore this foreign land.All the paved roads on this tour were part of the ancient silk route that was used for transporting silk and spices from China to the European continent. However, the real beauty of Kyrgyzstan reveals itself only when you venture off-road. Our route has a mix of paved and dirt road riding that takes you through breath-taking landscapes and mountain passes.That’s not all, carefully selected sights like the Tash Rabat caravanserai and cultural experiences like the traditional horse games, eagle hunting, lunch in a yurt (traditional Central Asian round tent) and the folklore show will give you an enriching insight into the nomadic lifestyle of the Kyrgyz.
27th July to 2nd August 2025

tours.name: Northern Europe Motorcycle Tour
highlights: Flanked by Russia to the east and the Baltic Sea to the west, the ‘Baltic States’ of Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania in northern Europe are an enchanting land of untouched forests, endless beaches and medieval castles. Their long Soviet past has left indelible impressions in the form of Stalinist architecture and the occasional Lada cars zooming around, while the old towns of Tallinn, Riga and Vilnius exude the typical European charm – cobbled streets, cosy cafes and UNESCO World Heritage Sites.This weeklong tour across three countries starts in Tallinn (Estonia) and ends in Vilnius (Lithuania). A MotoRover tour manager will lead the ride on a motorcycle and a sweep car will follow the riders to ensure no one is left behind and to carry the group’s luggage. Our route has a good mix of wide open highways where you can revel in flat out riding while the carefully chosen winding countryside roads offer stunning rural landscapes of fields, blue skies, lakes and Baroque architecture. Riding will be on paved roads and there are four different options of touring bikes to choose from.The northern Europe motorcycle tour balances out the riding and free time for you to enjoy riding along the Baltic Sea and indulging in Soviet era experiences. Hotels are centrally located in big cities where you can take a walking tour of the beautiful old towns and shop for Baltic amber. Ride with us this August to explore the forgotten part of the European continent.

tours.name: Scotland Motorcycle Tour
highlights: Scotland is the most beautiful part of Britain. The mountains, the meadows, the lochs and the stunning skies in the Scottish countryside create spectacular landscapes and the cliffed coastline offers dramatic views.The country has some of the best riding roads in the world and MotoRover is offering you the chance to explore them on BMW motorcycles! There are five motorcycle options to select from and the small group size will ensure a personalised experience.MotoRover’s guide on the lead bike will look after the navigation, speed limits, re-fuelling stops and breakdown assistance, while a sweep car will follow the group to ensure none of the riders lose their way. The sweep car will also have a few empty seats, a first-aid kit, a photographer and the rider’s luggage.This weeklong motorcycle tour will start and end in Scotland’s capital, Edinburgh. Highlights of the route include the Scottish Highlands, the famous North Coast 500 circuit and the stunning Isle of Skye. Enjoy Scottish music, discover the whisky heritage, taste the local food and try to pick up the brogue Scottish accent when you interact with the locals.
2-8 September, 2018*Bookings close on 31 July, 2018

tours.name: Spain & France Motorcycle Tour
highlights: Spain and France are among the most beautiful countries in western Europe and we are offering you a taste of both on a motorcycling adventure!Our route explores the border region of the two countries and has a wide variety of scenery as it traces through seaside towns, picturesque alpine passes in France and rocky landscapes of Spain.This weeklong road trip begins and ends in the Spanish city of Barcelona. Ride world-class motorcycles on fantastic roads along Costa Brava (north-eastern coast of Spain) with panoramic views of the Mediterranean Sea. Conquer some of the legendary mountain in the Pyrenees mountains that feature on the Tour de France bicycle race. Visit a motorcycle museum with a great collection of specimens from around the world and a museum of Grand Prix legend Marc Marquez in his hometown. Motorcycle Grand Prix racing enthusiasts will love the optional visit to the Catalan round of MotoGP and we have beautiful properties for overnight stays during the journey.The group will lead by MotoRover’s expert tour guide on a motorcycle along with a tour manager driving the support car. The support car will follow the riders to ensure no one is left behind and will carry your luggage too.All you have to do is sign up, arrive and ride!
7 to 14 September

tours.name: Morocco Motorcycle Tour
highlights: Morocco is the gateway to Saharan Africa. An exotic land with a unique mix of Arabic, French and Berber cultures that can be traced back to the country’s colonial past and its geographical location on the north-western tip of Africa. It is one of the safest countries on the continent and Moroccans are friendly and hospitable towards tourists.Along with its cultural diversity, Morocco is also known for its cuisine, art and ever-changing landscapes, which makes it an exciting country to explore on a motorcycle! Morocco first appeared on MotoRover’s tour calendar in 2019 and we have already completed seven successful road trips in the country with over 100 travellers!The 2026 edition is a 9 day motorcycle tour starting and ending in the biggest city of Morocco, Casablanca. The entire riding route is on paved roads and we are offering BMW and Husqvarna adventure touring rental motorcycle options for the ride. Contrary to the stereotype, Morocco is not just about the Sahara desert. It has vast mountain ranges spread across the length of the country and the entire northern and eastern border of Morocco is a coastline. Our route offers a good mix of terrain and landscapes as it covers the High Atlas and Middle Atlas mountains, the Sahara desert and the Atlantic coast of Morocco. Apart from the ride, we have plenty of sightseeing and activities on the tour including a break day in the Imperial city of Marrakech. Shop for local artefacts in the famous souqs of Marrakech, walk through narrow alleys of the fortified Medina (old town) and experience a sensory overload in Jemaa el Fna, the vibrant central square.A MotoRover guide will lead the tour on a motorcycle followed by the participating riders and the group will be followed by a support van that carries tools, a mechanic, a second MotoRover guide and your luggage. We have designed this tour after a thorough on-ground exploration of Morocco to give you a refined experience. The terrain is enjoyable for amateurs as well as experienced riders and the daily riding distance has been calculated to provide you with ample breaks and photo opportunities.Group size will be limited to 12 riders and apart from the motorcycles and support team, the tour package includes airport pickup/drop, breakfasts and dinners (veg/non-veg) and the accommodation will be in boutique hotels, Riads and luxury tent camps in the Sahara! All you have to do is arrive and ride.

tours.name: MotoRover - Motorcycle Tours & Self-Drive Car Road Trips
MotoRover - Motorcycle Tours & Self-Drive Car Road Trips
Southern Spain & Portugal Motorcycle Tour
highlights: MotoRover has been getting the early Sun in Europe since the year 2019 with our riding season starting with the motorcycle tour of Andalusia in Southern Spain. This year, we have added the Algarve region of Spain’s neighboring country, Portugal, to offer an exciting two-country riding experience on the Iberian Peninsula!The ride starts from the port city of Malaga in Spain and covers all the major cities in Southern Spain before crossing over into Portugal. A day’s break on the coast of Portugal will let you relax and enjoy the Sun, sand and Sea and then we explore the countryside of Algarve. Our route returns to Spain for the final leg of the journey as we make our way back to Malaga via Seville and the white villages of Spain.The riding route has a rich mix of coastal rides with spectacular sea views and twisty roads in the Sierras (mountains). You will be passing olive fields and national parks along the way with pit stops for local sightseeing and experiences.This is an 8-day/7-night tour in March 2025 led by an expert motorcycle guide from MotoRover. We are offering three choices of BMW GS adventure motorcycles with fuel, insurance and a top box for the ride and riders’ luggage will follow in the support van driven by a second guide from MotoRover. Group size will be limited to 12 riders and you have the option of getting a plus one for the pillion seat on their bike. We have beautiful 4-star hotels or similar level boutique properties for the overnight stays and we’ll be serving delicious cuisine during the tour as per your dietary preferences. The inclusion of airport pickup and drop and local sightseeing and experiences makes it an all-inclusive ground package motorcycle tour so you can focus on the holiday and not the planning.All you have to do is arrive and ride! Kindly go through the details of this tour further in this brochure and contact us to book your spot!

tours.name: Balkan Motorcycle Tour
highlights: The Balkan region is a hidden treasure for travellers looking for a quintessential East European experience. Blessed with the moderate Mediterranean climate, a long coastline and mountain ranges, the Balkan peninsula has the best of everything. Postcard cities with a medieval charm, beaches with turquoise waters, natural wonders and thrilling roads in the mountains and along the Dalmatian Coast.Our tour covers three countries- Croatia, Bosnia & Herzegovina and Montenegro which were all part of the erstwhile communist nation of SFRY (Yugoslavia). These are Slavic countries with a common culture and influences from Russia, Germany, Austria, Hungary, Italy and even the Turks who have all had political influence over this region through history.We are offering you a range of high-end touring motorcycles to explore the three countries and you will thoroughly enjoy the great mix of riding and experiences we have carefully curated.
20 to 29 April 2026

tours.name: Ultimate Alps Motorcycle Tour
highlights: The Alps Mountain range of Europe needs no introduction. It is the most naturally beautiful region of the continent, famous for its snow-covered peaks, spectacular alpine landscapes, ski resorts and twisty mountain passes.MotoRover’s first encounter with the Alps was in 2019 where we, along with BMW Motorrad India, organized the biggest international motorcycle tour ever done by an Indian group. The numbers? 43 riders and 11 pillions!We are reviving this epic motorcycle adventure and it’s going to be even better in 2026. The tour includes the most legendary mountain passes in the Alps, and the overnight stays will be in beautiful alpine properties.The tour will cover four countries in Central Europe; Germany, Austria, Italy and Switzerland. It starts and ends in the Italian city of Milan and will be led by a MotoRover guide on a motorcycle. We will also have a support van at the back of the group for luggage and assistance during the ride. Apart from the thrilling rides and great hotels, the route also promises beautiful views and interesting sights and activities.This is the ultimate motorcycle tour of the Alps. DO NOT MISS THIS.
13 to 21 July 2026

tours.name: New Zealand Motorcycle Tour
highlights: New Zealand is one of the most beautiful countries in the world and it is best explored by road. It is a land blessed with natural beauty and a great variety of features like mountains, glaciers, rivers, tropical forests, and a long coastline, since it is an island nation.It is known as the ‘Land Of The Long White Cloud’ due to its shape as seen from the sky and its Māori name (Māori were the first inhabitants of the islands before British colonization) is Aotearoa. It is an isolated archipelago in the South Pacific Ocean with two major landmasses, the North Island and the South Island. The southern island is bigger and more beautiful and that is where we conduct our motorcycle tour of New Zealand.Although an independent country since the year 1947, New Zealand has a British way of life. The ‘Kiwis’ as they are called, speak English, eat English, drive on the left side of the road and allow riding based on a Indian driving license, which makes it very easy to go around.Our motorcycle tour of New Zealand is a 9 day/8-night guided road trip starting and ending in the biggest city on the South Island, Christchurch. The tour will be led by a guide on a motorcycle and the participant bikes will be followed by luggage van. Besides the riding, the tour package also takes care of other travel requirements like accommodation, meals, airport transfers and local experiences.Join us for an epic adventure down under to end the year on a high!

tours.name: South Africa Motorcycle Tour
highlights: It’s time for Africa, again! After a successful ride in April 2025, MotoRover is back with another round of the South Africa Motorcycle Adventure scheduled for late October this year.This is a 9-day guided motorcycle tour conducted in a fly and ride format. This means all you have to do is book the tour, get your South Africa visa and fly into Cape Town. Every service from the time you arrive in Cape town till your departure is covered in our comprehensive tour package. Our ground team includes an expert motorcycle guide leading the group and a luggage van following our convoy to ensure that you travel with full support and safety. You will be given a rental BMW GS motorcycle as per your choice with a top box and fuel for the entire distance of the tour. Also included are 4 star or similar level hotels, all meals and bottled water, activities and entrance fees to nature reserves as per the tour program and airport pickup and drop in Cape town.Our riding route starts and ends in the seaside city of Cape Town and traces the famous ‘Garden Route’ of South Africa, the most naturally beautiful region of the country. It includes the spectacular cliffside rides along Chapman’s Peak, visit to the Cape of Good Hope and Cape Point, the southern-most point of the African continent at Cape Agulhas, winding roads, mountain passes and gravel sections.Along with the ride, you shall be enjoying exciting sights and activities like the Big 5 wildlife Safari, Cango caves in Oudtshoorn, Penguins at Boulder beach, a visit to the wine region of South Africa and a rest day in Knysna with multiple activity options. Entries will be limited to 12 riders and their pillions. So come along and join us on this adventure in the rainbow nation!
27 Oct to 04 Nov 2025
